text: Zafar Ahmad Chaudhry (Urdu: ظفر احمد چودھری; 19 August 1926 – 17 December 2019), , was a Pakistani human rights activist and an airline executive. He was the first Chief of Air Staff of Pakistan Air Force, appointed in 1972 until his resignation in 1974. He was born in Sialkot, Punjab in British India. Chaudhry died on 17 December 2019 in Lahore of cardiac arrest at the age of 93. ==References== Category:1926 births Category:2019 deaths Category:Pakistani generals Category:Pakistani businesspeople Category:Pakistani human rights activists
title: Zafar Chaudhry
